hook.text: Future generations will suffer from our carbon emissions. But they don't exist yet. Do they have rights?

buildup.text: Climate change raises a unique moral challenge: the people most harmed are those not yet born.

discovery.text: Some argue we owe future people the same consideration as present ones. Discounting them is unjust.

twist.text: The poorest countries suffer most from emissions they didn't produce. Geography becomes moral destiny.

climax.text: Climate ethics asks: who pays, how much, and for whom? No framework has a satisfying answer yet.

punchline.text: The hardest part is caring about people you'll never meet.

quiz.question: Why is climate change an especially difficult ethical issue?
options: It harms future generations who can't advocate for themselves
